frame.name: Reliance
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Protagonist</fen> needs a <fen>Means</fen> action performed for their <fen>Benefit</fen>. The relevant <fen>Means</fen> action is often evoked only by reference to an <fen>Intermediary</fen> who performs it. Also, if the <fen>Protagonist</fen> performs the <fen>Means</fen> action themselves, the <fen>Instrument</fen> that they use may be referred to in place of the <fen>Means</fen> Note that when one of the three interrelated FEs <fen>Means</fen>, <fen>Instrument</fen> and <fen>Intermediary</fen> is realized overtly, the other two are blocked from overt realization as clause-level arguments of the target.<ex></ex>
When the <fen>Protagonist</fen> is a sentient being, it is implied that they put their trust in the <fen>Intermediary</fen> to help in the achievement of the <fen>Benefit</fen>.
The extent to which the <fen>Protagonist</fen> is dependent on an <fen>Intermediary</fen> or <fen>Instrument</fen> can be indicated in a <fen>Degree</fen> phrase.<ex></ex>
A set of <fen>Circumstances</fen> in which the <fen>Protagonist</fen>'s need for the <fen>Benefit</fen> arises, may also be specified. <ex></ex>
The difference between the <fen>Benefit</fen> that the <fen>Means</fen> action provides and the <fen>Purpose</fen> that the <fen>Protagonist</fen> has is very subtle. For our purposes we will assume that one can form a predication from <fen>Benefit</fen> and <fen>Means</fen> on the one hand, and <fen>Protagonist</fen> and <fen>Purpose</fen> on the other, but that they cannot be intermingled (cf. examples (7) and (8) below). With for-PPs such as in (6) it is not clear which FE they instantiate, <fen>Benefit</fen> or <fen>Purpose</fen>. We will arbitrarily call them <fen>Benefit</fen><ex></ex>
<ex>(1) <fex name="Protagonist">I</fex> <t>rely</t> <fex name="Intermediary">on you</fex> <fex name="Benefit">to see that my name is not sullied</fex>.</ex>
<ex>(2) <fex name="Protagonist">The system</fex> can <t>rely</t> <fex name="Degree">entirely</fex> <fex name="Instrument">on coaxial cable</fex> or entirely on optical fibre, just as a tree and branch network can be based on either technology .</ex>
<ex>(3) The Tories had got him into this and <fex name="Protagonist">he</fex> <t>relied</t> <fex name="Intermediary">on them</fex> <fex name="Benefit">to get him out</fex>.</ex>
<ex>(4) I knew <fex name="Protagonist">we</fex> could <t>rely</t> <fex name="Intermediary">on you</fex>. <fex name="Benefit">DNI</fex> </ex>
<ex>(5) <fex name="Benefit">To get the economy moving</fex> <fex name="Protagonist">he</fex> will <t>rely</t> <fex name="Means">on repairing the infrastructure of America</fex></ex>
<ex>(6) Later , when the Northern Ireland Office was established , <fex name="Protagonist">it</fex> <t>relied</t> <fex name="Degree">heavily</fex> <fex name="Intermediary">on it</fex> <fex name="Benefit">for the information on which it based security and political activities</fex>.</ex>
<ex>(7) <fex name="Protagonist">She</fex> would have to <t>rely</t> <fex name="Means">on his help</fex> <fex name="Purpose">to get through the fight in one piece</fex>. -- She got through the fight in one piece/*His help got through the fight in one piece</ex>
<ex>(8) <fex name="Protagonist">I</fex> <t>rely</t> <fex name="Means">on his help</fex> <fex name="Benefit">to get me through a long season</fex> -- His help got me through a long season/*I got me through a long season </ex>
<ex>(9) <fex name="Protagonist">We</fex> <t>rely</t> <fex name="Means">on your helping us</fex> </ex>
<ex> (10) You can <t>rely</t> on him <fex name="Circumstances">when the chips are down</fex> to inspire the troops</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Protagonist
FE.definition:
<def-root>The person or thing whose needs are served by the <fen>Means</fen> action.
<ex> <fex name="Protagonist">I</fex> <t>rely</t> on this walking stick to get me around</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Benefit
FE.definition:
<def-root>An action or state that the <fen>Means</fen> action brings about and from which the <fen>Protagonist</fen> profits.
<ex>He still <t>relies</t> on me <fex name="Benefit">to do the head work</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>The extent to which the achievement of the <fen>Benefit</fen> depends on the <fen>Means</fen> action.
<ex> He knows I <t>rely</t> <fex name="Degree">entirely</fex> on him to point out all my blunders and spelling mistakes.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Intermediary
FE.definition:
<def-root>The person or thing that performs a <fen>Means</fen> action to the <fen>Benefit</fen> of the <fen>Protagonist</fen>.
<ex>We <t>rely</t> <fex name="Intermediary">on you</fex> for feedback and input</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Instrument
FE.definition:
<def-root>An object that the <fen>Protagonist</fen> uses to realize a <fen>Benefit</fen>.
<ex>I hate having to <t>rely</t> <fex name="Instrument">on my car</fex> to get where I want to go</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition:
<def-root>An action or state that the <fen>Protagonist</fen> wants to bring about. It is more or less the <fen>Benefit</fen> viewed in relation to the <fen>Protagonist</fen> rather than the <fen>Means</fen>.
<ex>The user will quickly begin to <t>rely</t> on the pills <fex name="Purpose">to cope with life pressures</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition:
<def-root>An action performed either by the <fen>Protagonist</fen> or an <fen>Intermediary</fen> that has a <fen>Benefit</fen> for the <fen>Protagonist</fen> attached to it.
<ex>We <t>rely</t> <fex name="Means">on your response</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition:
<def-root>The conditions when the <fen>Protagonist</fen> needs to rely on an <fen>Instrument</fen> or <fen>Intermediary</fen>.
<ex>We have to fully rely on him <fex name="Circumstances">when times get a little rough</fex></ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: rely.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: depend on with full trust.

lexUnit.name: reliance.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: dependence on or trust in someone or something

lexUnit.name: dependence.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of relying on someone or something for financial or other support.

lexUnit.name: dependency.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of relying on someone or something for financial or other support.
